intro: Rouhamon guianense var. ecirrhosum, commonly known as the Guianan rouhamon, is a rare tropical plant native to South America. It is characterized by its distinctive, elongated leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellow in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
